Key Match Events: Mehedi Hasan's own goal in the 29th minute
Kusini Yengi's header in the 62nd minute secured the win
Post-Match Reflections: Graham Arnold was critical of the surface at the Bashundhara Kings Arena, calling it 'unacceptable' and 'dangerous'
Nestory Irankunda was grateful for his debut and proud to cap for the nation
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a'stinking hot' day with high humidity
The Socceroos dominated possession, but struggled to create quality chances against Bangladesh's packed backline
Others: Jordy Bos was Australia's best player, demonstrating why he might have quietly developed into one of the best prospects the Socceroos have produced in decades
